intro: Sameraria platyptera, commonly known as the broad-winged sameraria, is a unique member of the Bromeliaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its striking, broad, and flat leaves that form a rosette shape. Its flowers, which are typically yellow or orange, are borne on tall, slender stalks above the foliage. Sameraria platyptera is adapted to grow in shaded, humid environments, often found in forest understories.
